 What happens when the network defenders get so good that you can no longer do command
and control over the network without being detected?
When your job depends on it, you get creative and do it out of band.

how you too can do it for fun, a more pragmatic approach and what to look for if you're defending.

build a safer, secure and more resilient world by sharing knowledge through telling stories.

APRS is a real-time technical digital communications protocol
for exchanging information between a large number of stations covering
a large local area.
It was initially developed at the U.S. Naval Academy by Brock Bruninger.
It was used for technical messaging and position tracking,
including by FEMA.
It is now a global amateur radio comms network built on top of AX25.
It's on two meters in the U.S.
It's on 144.39 megahertz.
In Australia, the national network is operating on 145.175 megahertz.
It is within the amateur radio license spectrum.
